page.title: 09LOWLAND FARMING-HOLKER MOSS.
page.content: The farming use of the lowland in the area is mainly for the rough grazing of{sheep}and{beef cattle.} The poor pasture does not enable milk cows to be farmed as a low yield would be gained from these cows. The beef cattle are mainly{Black {Limousin}with a handful of{Charolais} and{Friesians.}These are all fairly hardy cattle and are able to stand the poor winters and mild ,windy summers which are common.Some cross- bred sheep graze together with the cattle. The only crops are{hay,silage}and {potatoes}and a selection of{market {garden crops}grown in greenhouses.The land is badly drained and so ditches have been dug.In winter the land is often flooded.The hay and silage will be fed to the cattle in winter when the grass is of poor quality.
